definition: medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]

sentences.english: Herbal cuisine is a special dietary cuisine which combines the effect of medicines and de taste of foods.
sentences.chinese: 药膳是一种兼有药物功效和食品美味的特殊膳食。

sentences.english: Many in the Diet have seen crystal sugar.
sentences.chinese: 在很多药膳中都冰糖的身影。

sentences.english: To the south of medicinal food hall opened, but tastes bad.
sentences.chinese: 向南的药膳馆开业了，可是味道不好。

sentences.english: He is now opened a braised food store, to do medicinal food.
sentences.chinese: 他目前开了一家卤味店，要做药膳。

sentences.english: Angelica still can make officinal board together with other edibles .
sentences.chinese: 当归还可与其他食物一起制成药膳。

sentences.english: Enjoy the famous Medicinal Food for dinner tonight.
West light invited a gourmet to medicinal food fang taste.
sentences.chinese: 西光约请了一位美食家到药膳坊品味。

sentences.english: Medicine processing skills are also applicable in medicative diet cooking in modern cuisine.
sentences.chinese: 所以炮制技术也可应用于烹饪现代的药膳料理。

definition: lit. food and medicine come from the same source (idiom)/fig. there is no clear-cut distinction between food and medicine
four-substance decoction (si wu tang), tonic formula used in Chinese medicine
tonic food (food considered to be particularly healthful)/to eat such foods
huangqi/milk vetch root (used in TCM)/Astragalus membranaceus or Astragalus mongholicus
to nourish one's skin/to maintain a youthful appearance
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
